Recipe.name: Recipe
Recipe.description: A recipe. For dietary restrictions covered by the recipe, a few common restrictions are enumerated via suitableForDiet. The keywords property can also be used to add more detail.

Demand.name: Demand
Demand.description: A demand entity represents the public, not necessarily binding, not necessarily exclusive, announcement by an organization or person to seek a certain type of goods or services. For describing demand using this type, the very same properties used for Offer apply.

ExerciseAction.name: ExerciseAction
ExerciseAction.description: The act of participating in exertive activity for the purposes of improving health and fitness.

FoodService.name: FoodService
FoodService.description: A food service, like breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

SeaBodyOfWater.name: SeaBodyOfWater
SeaBodyOfWater.description: A sea (for example, the Caspian sea).

Dataset.name: Dataset
Dataset.description: A body of structured information describing some topic(s) of interest.

Action.name: Action
Action.description:
An action performed by a direct agent and indirect participants upon a direct object. Optionally happens at a location with the help of an inanimate instrument. The execution of the action may produce a result. Specific action sub-type documentation specifies the exact expectation of each argument/role.

See also blog post and Actions overview document.

TaxiReservation.name: TaxiReservation
TaxiReservation.description:
A reservation for a taxi.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use Offer.

Vehicle.name: Vehicle
Vehicle.description: A vehicle is a device that is designed or used to transport people or cargo over land, water, air, or through space.

SomeProducts.name: SomeProducts
SomeProducts.description: A placeholder for multiple similar products of the same kind.

MoveAction.name: MoveAction
MoveAction.description:
The act of an agent relocating to a place.

Related actions:

  • TransferAction: Unlike TransferAction, the subject of the move is a living Person or Organization rather than an inanimate object.

CreativeWork.name: CreativeWork
CreativeWork.description: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

AddAction.name: AddAction
AddAction.description: The act of editing by adding an object to a collection.

ViewAction.name: ViewAction
ViewAction.description: The act of consuming static visual content.

WPFooter.name: WPFooter
WPFooter.description: The footer section of the page.

QAPage.name: QAPage
QAPage.description: A QAPage is a WebPage focussed on a specific Question and its Answer(s), e.g. in a question answering site or documenting Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs).

LikeAction.name: LikeAction
LikeAction.description: The act of expressing a positive sentiment about the object. An agent likes an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

PublicationEvent.name: PublicationEvent
PublicationEvent.description: A PublicationEvent corresponds indifferently to the event of publication for a CreativeWork of any type e.g. a broadcast event, an on-demand event, a book/journal publication via a variety of delivery media.

Course.name: Course
Course.description: A description of an educational course which may be offered as distinct instances at which take place at different times or take place at different locations, or be offered through different media or modes of study. An educational course is a sequence of one or more educational events and/or creative works which aims to build knowledge, competence or ability of learners.

ParcelService.name: ParcelService
ParcelService.description:
A private parcel service as the delivery mode available for a certain offer.

Commonly used values:

  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DHL
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#FederalExpress
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#UPS

BefriendAction.name: BefriendAction
BefriendAction.description:
The act of forming a personal connection with someone (object) mutually/bidirectionally/symmetrically.

Related actions:

  • FollowAction: Unlike FollowAction, BefriendAction implies that the connection is reciprocal.

HowTo.name: HowTo
HowTo.description: Instructions that explain how to achieve a result by performing a sequence of steps.

DownloadAction.name: DownloadAction
DownloadAction.description: The act of downloading an object.

HowToSection.name: HowToSection
HowToSection.description: A sub-grouping of steps in the instructions for how to achieve a result (e.g. steps for making a pie crust within a pie recipe).

Person.name: Person
Person.description: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

DeliveryChargeSpecification.name: DeliveryChargeSpecification
DeliveryChargeSpecification.description: The price for the delivery of an offer using a particular delivery method.

LendAction.name: LendAction
LendAction.description:
The act of providing an object under an agreement that it will be returned at a later date. Reciprocal of BorrowAction.

Related actions:

  • BorrowAction: Reciprocal of LendAction.

ListenAction.name: ListenAction
ListenAction.description: The act of consuming audio content.

TransferAction.name: TransferAction
TransferAction.description: The act of transferring/moving (abstract or concrete) animate or inanimate objects from one place to another.

SiteNavigationElement.name: SiteNavigationElement
SiteNavigationElement.description: A navigation element of the page.

Organization.name: Organization
Organization.description: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

DeleteAction.name: DeleteAction
DeleteAction.description: The act of editing a recipient by removing one of its objects.

TradeAction.name: TradeAction
TradeAction.description: The act of participating in an exchange of goods and services for monetary compensation. An agent trades an object, product or service with a participant in exchange for a one time or periodic payment.

LegalService.name: LegalService
LegalService.description:
A LegalService is a business that provides legally-oriented services, advice and representation, e.g. law firms.

As a LocalBusiness it can be described as a provider of one or more Service(s).

VisualArtwork.name: VisualArtwork
VisualArtwork.description: A work of art that is primarily visual in character.

Attorney.name: Attorney
Attorney.description:
Professional service: Attorney.

This type is deprecated - LegalService is more inclusive and less ambiguous.

RsvpAction.name: RsvpAction
RsvpAction.description: The act of notifying an event organizer as to whether you expect to attend the event.

Rating.name: Rating
Rating.description: A rating is an evaluation on a numeric scale, such as 1 to 5 stars.

RegisterAction.name: RegisterAction
RegisterAction.description:
The act of registering to be a user of a service, product or web page.

Related actions:

  • JoinAction: Unlike JoinAction, RegisterAction implies you are registering to be a user of a service, not a group/team of people.
  • [FollowAction]]: Unlike FollowAction, RegisterAction doesn't imply that the agent is expecting to poll for updates from the object.
  • SubscribeAction: Unlike SubscribeAction, RegisterAction doesn't imply that the agent is expecting updates from the object.

Trip.name: Trip
Trip.description: A trip or journey. An itinerary of visits to one or more places.

WatchAction.name: WatchAction
WatchAction.description: The act of consuming dynamic/moving visual content.

ResumeAction.name: ResumeAction
ResumeAction.description: The act of resuming a device or application which was formerly paused (e.g. resume music playback or resume a timer).

BedAndBreakfast.name: BedAndBreakfast
BedAndBreakfast.description:
Bed and breakfast.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

Suite.name: Suite
Suite.description:
A suite in a hotel or other public accommodation, denotes a class of luxury accommodations, the key feature of which is multiple rooms (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suite_(hotel)).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

Reservoir.name: Reservoir
Reservoir.description: A reservoir of water, typically an artificially created lake, like the Lake Kariba reservoir.

GiveAction.name: GiveAction
GiveAction.description:
The act of transferring ownership of an object to a destination. Reciprocal of TakeAction.

Related actions:

  • TakeAction: Reciprocal of GiveAction.
  • SendAction: Unlike SendAction, GiveAction implies that ownership is being transferred (e.g. I may send my laptop to you, but that doesn't mean I'm giving it to you).

Accommodation.name: Accommodation
Accommodation.description:
An accommodation is a place that can accommodate human beings, e.g. a hotel room, a camping pitch, or a meeting room. Many accommodations are for overnight stays, but this is not a mandatory requirement. For more specific types of accommodations not defined in schema.org, one can use additionalType with external vocabularies.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

Barcode.name: Barcode
Barcode.description: An image of a visual machine-readable code such as a barcode or QR code.

AggregateOffer.name: AggregateOffer
AggregateOffer.description: When a single product is associated with multiple offers (for example, the same pair of shoes is offered by different merchants), then AggregateOffer can be used.

HowToSupply.name: HowToSupply
HowToSupply.description: A supply consumed when performing the instructions for how to achieve a result.

DisagreeAction.name: DisagreeAction
DisagreeAction.description: The act of expressing a difference of opinion with the object. An agent disagrees to/about an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

ReservationPackage.name: ReservationPackage
ReservationPackage.description: A group of multiple reservations with common values for all sub-reservations.

FinancialProduct.name: FinancialProduct
FinancialProduct.description: A product provided to consumers and businesses by financial institutions such as banks, insurance companies, brokerage firms, consumer finance companies, and investment companies which comprise the financial services industry.

TrackAction.name: TrackAction
TrackAction.description:
An agent tracks an object for updates.

Related actions:

  • FollowAction: Unlike FollowAction, TrackAction refers to the interest on the location of innanimates objects.
  • SubscribeAction: Unlike SubscribeAction, TrackAction refers to the interest on the location of innanimate objects.

HomeAndConstructionBusiness.name: HomeAndConstructionBusiness
HomeAndConstructionBusiness.description:
A construction business.

A HomeAndConstructionBusiness is a LocalBusiness that provides services around homes and buildings.

As a LocalBusiness it can be described as a provider of one or more Service(s).

ProgramMembership.name: ProgramMembership
ProgramMembership.description: Used to describe membership in a loyalty programs (e.g. "StarAliance"), traveler clubs (e.g. "AAA"), purchase clubs ("Safeway Club"), etc.

ControlAction.name: ControlAction
ControlAction.description: An agent controls a device or application.

CheckAction.name: CheckAction
CheckAction.description: An agent inspects, determines, investigates, inquires, or examines an object's accuracy, quality, condition, or state.

DanceGroup.name: DanceGroup
DanceGroup.description: A dance group—for example, the Alvin Ailey Dance Theater or Riverdance.

Game.name: Game
Game.description: The Game type represents things which are games. These are typically rule-governed recreational activities, e.g. role-playing games in which players assume the role of characters in a fictional setting.

DiscussionForumPosting.name: DiscussionForumPosting
DiscussionForumPosting.description: A posting to a discussion forum.

TouristAttraction.name: TouristAttraction
TouristAttraction.description: A tourist attraction. In principle any Thing can be a TouristAttraction, from a Mountain and LandmarksOrHistoricalBuildings to a LocalBusiness. This Type can be used on its own to describe a general TouristAttraction, or be used as an additionalType to add tourist attraction properties to any other type. (See examples below)

Car.name: Car
Car.description: A car is a wheeled, self-powered motor vehicle used for transportation.

PriceSpecification.name: PriceSpecification
PriceSpecification.description: A structured value representing a price or price range. Typically, only the subclasses of this type are used for markup. It is recommended to use MonetaryAmount to describe independent amounts of money such as a salary, credit card limits, etc.

DrawAction.name: DrawAction
DrawAction.description: The act of producing a visual/graphical representation of an object, typically with a pen/pencil and paper as instruments.

PaymentCard.name: PaymentCard
PaymentCard.description: A payment method using a credit, debit, store or other card to associate the payment with an account.

PublicationVolume.name: PublicationVolume
PublicationVolume.description:
A part of a successively published publication such as a periodical or multi-volume work, often numbered. It may represent a time span, such as a year.

  <br/><br/>See also <a href="http://blog.schema.org/2014/09/schemaorg-support-for-bibliographic_2.html">blog post</a>.

LocalBusiness.name: LocalBusiness
LocalBusiness.description: A particular physical business or branch of an organization. Examples of LocalBusiness include a restaurant, a particular branch of a restaurant chain, a branch of a bank, a medical practice, a club, a bowling alley, etc.

CancelAction.name: CancelAction
CancelAction.description:
The act of asserting that a future event/action is no longer going to happen.

Related actions:

  • ConfirmAction: The antonym of CancelAction.

IgnoreAction.name: IgnoreAction
IgnoreAction.description: The act of intentionally disregarding the object. An agent ignores an object.

MusicRecording.name: MusicRecording
MusicRecording.description: A music recording (track), usually a single song.

CheckOutAction.name: CheckOutAction
CheckOutAction.description:
The act of an agent communicating (service provider, social media, etc) their departure of a previously reserved service (e.g. flight check in) or place (e.g. hotel).

Related actions:

  • CheckInAction: The antonym of CheckOutAction.
  • DepartAction: Unlike DepartAction, CheckOutAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the end of a previously reserved service.
  • CancelAction: Unlike CancelAction, CheckOutAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the end of a previously reserved service.

BankAccount.name: BankAccount
BankAccount.description: A product or service offered by a bank whereby one may deposit, withdraw or transfer money and in some cases be paid interest.

MenuItem.name: MenuItem
MenuItem.description: A food or drink item listed in a menu or menu section.

ApplyAction.name: ApplyAction
ApplyAction.description:
The act of registering to an organization/service without the guarantee to receive it.

Related actions:

  • RegisterAction: Unlike RegisterAction, ApplyAction has no guarantees that the application will be accepted.

SportsOrganization.name: SportsOrganization
SportsOrganization.description: Represents the collection of all sports organizations, including sports teams, governing bodies, and sports associations.

CableOrSatelliteService.name: CableOrSatelliteService
CableOrSatelliteService.description: A service which provides access to media programming like TV or radio. Access may be via cable or satellite.

TVSeason.name: TVSeason
TVSeason.description: Season dedicated to TV broadcast and associated online delivery.

SearchResultsPage.name: SearchResultsPage
SearchResultsPage.description: Web page type: Search results page.

EntryPoint.name: EntryPoint
EntryPoint.description: An entry point, within some Web-based protocol.

DigitalDocumentPermission.name: DigitalDocumentPermission
DigitalDocumentPermission.description: A permission for a particular person or group to access a particular file.

InviteAction.name: InviteAction
InviteAction.description: The act of asking someone to attend an event. Reciprocal of RsvpAction.

TVEpisode.name: TVEpisode
TVEpisode.description: A TV episode which can be part of a series or season.

MusicGroup.name: MusicGroup
MusicGroup.description: A musical group, such as a band, an orchestra, or a choir. Can also be a solo musician.

MobilePhoneStore.name: MobilePhoneStore
MobilePhoneStore.description: A store that sells mobile phones and related accessories.

SubscribeAction.name: SubscribeAction
SubscribeAction.description:
The act of forming a personal connection with someone/something (object) unidirectionally/asymmetrically to get updates pushed to.

Related actions:

  • FollowAction: Unlike FollowAction, SubscribeAction implies that the subscriber acts as a passive agent being constantly/actively pushed for updates.
  • RegisterAction: Unlike RegisterAction, SubscribeAction implies that the agent is interested in continuing receiving updates from the object.
  • JoinAction: Unlike JoinAction, SubscribeAction implies that the agent is interested in continuing receiving updates from the object.

RiverBodyOfWater.name: RiverBodyOfWater
RiverBodyOfWater.description: A river (for example, the broad majestic Shannon).

GameServer.name: GameServer
GameServer.description: Server that provides game interaction in a multiplayer game.

DepositAccount.name: DepositAccount
DepositAccount.description: A type of Bank Account with a main purpose of depositing funds to gain interest or other benefits.

Motel.name: Motel
Motel.description:
A motel.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

WPAdBlock.name: WPAdBlock
WPAdBlock.description: An advertising section of the page.

DefenceEstablishment.name: DefenceEstablishment
DefenceEstablishment.description: A defence establishment, such as an army or navy base.

BreadcrumbList.name: BreadcrumbList
BreadcrumbList.description:
A BreadcrumbList is an ItemList consisting of a chain of linked Web pages, typically described using at least their URL and their name, and typically ending with the current page.

The position property is used to reconstruct the order of the items in a BreadcrumbList The convention is that a breadcrumb list has an itemListOrder of ItemListOrderAscending (lower values listed first), and that the first items in this list correspond to the "top" or beginning of the breadcrumb trail, e.g. with a site or section homepage. The specific values of 'position' are not assigned meaning for a BreadcrumbList, but they should be integers, e.g. beginning with '1' for the first item in the list.

LiquorStore.name: LiquorStore
LiquorStore.description: A shop that sells alcoholic drinks such as wine, beer, whisky and other spirits.

PublicationIssue.name: PublicationIssue
PublicationIssue.description:
A part of a successively published publication such as a periodical or publication volume, often numbered, usually containing a grouping of works such as articles.

blog post.

Continent.name: Continent
Continent.description: One of the continents (for example, Europe or Africa).

Article.name: Article
Article.description:
An article, such as a news article or piece of investigative report. Newspapers and magazines have articles of many different types and this is intended to cover them all.

See also blog post.

WebPageElement.name: WebPageElement
WebPageElement.description: A web page element, like a table or an image.

VideoGame.name: VideoGame
VideoGame.description: A video game is an electronic game that involves human interaction with a user interface to generate visual feedback on a video device.

Airline.name: Airline
Airline.description: An organization that provides flights for passengers.

LiveBlogPosting.name: LiveBlogPosting
LiveBlogPosting.description: A blog post intended to provide a rolling textual coverage of an ongoing event through continuous updates.

MenuSection.name: MenuSection
MenuSection.description: A sub-grouping of food or drink items in a menu. E.g. courses (such as 'Dinner', 'Breakfast', etc.), specific type of dishes (such as 'Meat', 'Vegan', 'Drinks', etc.), or some other classification made by the menu provider.

AchieveAction.name: AchieveAction
AchieveAction.description: The act of accomplishing something via previous efforts. It is an instantaneous action rather than an ongoing process.

HotelRoom.name: HotelRoom
HotelRoom.description:
A hotel room is a single room in a hotel.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

WebSite.name: WebSite
WebSite.description: A WebSite is a set of related web pages and other items typically served from a single web domain and accessible via URLs.

EventReservation.name: EventReservation
EventReservation.description:
A reservation for an event like a concert, sporting event, or lecture.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use Offer.

OrganizeAction.name: OrganizeAction
OrganizeAction.description: The act of manipulating/administering/supervising/controlling one or more objects.

Audience.name: Audience
Audience.description: Intended audience for an item, i.e. the group for whom the item was created.

AgreeAction.name: AgreeAction
AgreeAction.description: The act of expressing a consistency of opinion with the object. An agent agrees to/about an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

UseAction.name: UseAction
UseAction.description: The act of applying an object to its intended purpose.

APIReference.name: APIReference
APIReference.description: Reference documentation for application programming interfaces (APIs).

TravelAction.name: TravelAction
TravelAction.description: The act of traveling from an fromLocation to a destination by a specified mode of transport, optionally with participants.

FilmAction.name: FilmAction
FilmAction.description: The act of capturing sound and moving images on film, video, or digitally.

MobileApplication.name: MobileApplication
MobileApplication.description: A software application designed specifically to work well on a mobile device such as a telephone.

TextDigitalDocument.name: TextDigitalDocument
TextDigitalDocument.description: A file composed primarily of text.

PlanAction.name: PlanAction
PlanAction.description: The act of planning the execution of an event/task/action/reservation/plan to a future date.

PlaceOfWorship.name: PlaceOfWorship
PlaceOfWorship.description: Place of worship, such as a church, synagogue, or mosque.

HowToTip.name: HowToTip
HowToTip.description: An explanation in the instructions for how to achieve a result. It provides supplementary information about a technique, supply, author's preference, etc. It can explain what could be done, or what should not be done, but doesn't specify what should be done (see HowToDirection).

ComputerLanguage.name: ComputerLanguage
ComputerLanguage.description: This type covers computer programming languages such as Scheme and Lisp, as well as other language-like computer representations. Natural languages are best represented with the Language type.

PerformanceRole.name: PerformanceRole
PerformanceRole.description: A PerformanceRole is a Role that some entity places with regard to a theatrical performance, e.g. in a Movie, TVSeries etc.

UnitPriceSpecification.name: UnitPriceSpecification
UnitPriceSpecification.description: The price asked for a given offer by the respective organization or person.

PerformAction.name: PerformAction
PerformAction.description: The act of participating in performance arts.

Mountain.name: Mountain
Mountain.description: A mountain, like Mount Whitney or Mount Everest.

CivicStructure.name: CivicStructure
CivicStructure.description: A public structure, such as a town hall or concert hall.

ReceiveAction.name: ReceiveAction
ReceiveAction.description:
The act of physically/electronically taking delivery of an object thathas been transferred from an origin to a destination. Reciprocal of SendAction.

Related actions:

  • SendAction: The reciprocal of ReceiveAction.
  • TakeAction: Unlike TakeAction, ReceiveAction does not imply that the ownership has been transfered (e.g. I can receive a package, but it does not mean the package is now mine).

VideoGameClip.name: VideoGameClip
VideoGameClip.description: A short segment/part of a video game.

QuoteAction.name: QuoteAction
QuoteAction.description: An agent quotes/estimates/appraises an object/product/service with a price at a location/store.

PropertyValue.name: PropertyValue
PropertyValue.description:
A property-value pair, e.g. representing a feature of a product or place. Use the 'name' property for the name of the property. If there is an additional human-readable version of the value, put that into the 'description' property.

Always use specific schema.org properties when a) they exist and b) you can populate them. Using PropertyValue as a substitute will typically not trigger the same effect as using the original, specific property.

ListItem.name: ListItem
ListItem.description: An list item, e.g. a step in a checklist or how-to description.

LodgingReservation.name: LodgingReservation
LodgingReservation.description:
A reservation for lodging at a hotel, motel, inn, etc.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations.

PresentationDigitalDocument.name: PresentationDigitalDocument
PresentationDigitalDocument.description: A file containing slides or used for a presentation.

Report.name: Report
Report.description: A Report generated by governmental or non-governmental organization.

StructuredValue.name: StructuredValue
StructuredValue.description: Structured values are used when the value of a property has a more complex structure than simply being a textual value or a reference to another thing.

LocationFeatureSpecification.name: LocationFeatureSpecification
LocationFeatureSpecification.description: Specifies a location feature by providing a structured value representing a feature of an accommodation as a property-value pair of varying degrees of formality.

MusicRelease.name: MusicRelease
MusicRelease.description: A MusicRelease is a specific release of a music album.

TechArticle.name: TechArticle
TechArticle.description: A technical article - Example: How-to (task) topics, step-by-step, procedural troubleshooting, specifications, etc.

DepartAction.name: DepartAction
DepartAction.description: The act of  departing from a place. An agent departs from an fromLocation for a destination, optionally with participants.

Comment.name: Comment
Comment.description: A comment on an item - for example, a comment on a blog post. The comment's content is expressed via the text property, and its topic via about, properties shared with all CreativeWorks.

WPSideBar.name: WPSideBar
WPSideBar.description: A sidebar section of the page.

FlightReservation.name: FlightReservation
FlightReservation.description:
A reservation for air travel.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use Offer.

AlignmentObject.name: AlignmentObject
AlignmentObject.description: An intangible item that describes an alignment between a learning resource and a node in an educational framework.

SellAction.name: SellAction
SellAction.description: The act of taking money from a buyer in exchange for goods or services rendered. An agent sells an object, product, or service to a buyer for a price. Reciprocal of BuyAction.

OnDemandEvent.name: OnDemandEvent
OnDemandEvent.description: A publication event e.g. catch-up TV or radio podcast, during which a program is available on-demand.

ChooseAction.name: ChooseAction
ChooseAction.description: The act of expressing a preference from a set of options or a large or unbounded set of choices/options.

GovernmentOffice.name: GovernmentOffice
GovernmentOffice.description: A government office—for example, an IRS or DMV office.

Place.name: Place
Place.description: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

SendAction.name: SendAction
SendAction.description:
The act of physically/electronically dispatching an object for transfer from an origin to a destination.Related actions:

  • ReceiveAction: The reciprocal of SendAction.
  • GiveAction: Unlike GiveAction, SendAction does not imply the transfer of ownership (e.g. I can send you my laptop, but I'm not necessarily giving it to you).

LeaveAction.name: LeaveAction
LeaveAction.description:
An agent leaves an event / group with participants/friends at a location.

Related actions:

  • JoinAction: The antonym of LeaveAction.
  • UnRegisterAction: Unlike UnRegisterAction, LeaveAction implies leaving a group/team of people rather than a service.

AssessAction.name: AssessAction
AssessAction.description: The act of forming one's opinion, reaction or sentiment.

CommentAction.name: CommentAction
CommentAction.description: The act of generating a comment about a subject.

ProfessionalService.name: ProfessionalService
ProfessionalService.description:
Original definition: "provider of professional services."

The general ProfessionalService type for local businesses was deprecated due to confusion with Service. For reference, the types that it included were: Dentist, AccountingService, Attorney, Notary, as well as types for several kinds of HomeAndConstructionBusiness: Electrician, GeneralContractor, HousePainter, Locksmith, Plumber, RoofingContractor. LegalService was introduced as a more inclusive supertype of Attorney.

GeoShape.name: GeoShape
GeoShape.description: The geographic shape of a place. A GeoShape can be described using several properties whose values are based on latitude/longitude pairs. Either whitespace or commas can be used to separate latitude and longitude; whitespace should be used when writing a list of several such points.

BroadcastChannel.name: BroadcastChannel
BroadcastChannel.description: A unique instance of a BroadcastService on a CableOrSatelliteService lineup.

Mass.name: Mass
Mass.description: Properties that take Mass as values are of the form '<Number> <Mass unit of measure>'. E.g., '7 kg'.

HowToTool.name: HowToTool
HowToTool.description: A tool used (but not consumed) when performing instructions for how to achieve a result.

WebPage.name: WebPage
WebPage.description: A web page. Every web page is implicitly assumed to be declared to be of type WebPage, so the various properties about that webpage, such as breadcrumb may be used. We recommend explicit declaration if these properties are specified, but if they are found outside of an itemscope, they will be assumed to be about the page.

Residence.name: Residence
Residence.description: The place where a person lives.

Room.name: Room
Room.description:
A room is a distinguishable space within a structure, usually separated from other spaces by interior walls. (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Room).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

ReplyAction.name: ReplyAction
ReplyAction.description:
The act of responding to a question/message asked/sent by the object. Related to AskAction

Related actions:

  • AskAction: Appears generally as an origin of a ReplyAction.

BusTrip.name: BusTrip
BusTrip.description: A trip on a commercial bus line.

UnRegisterAction.name: UnRegisterAction
UnRegisterAction.description:
The act of un-registering from a service.

Related actions:

  • RegisterAction: antonym of UnRegisterAction.
  • LeaveAction: Unlike LeaveAction, UnRegisterAction implies that you are unregistering from a service you werer previously registered, rather than leaving a team/group of people.

LoseAction.name: LoseAction
LoseAction.description: The act of being defeated in a competitive activity.

HowToStep.name: HowToStep
HowToStep.description: A step in the instructions for how to achieve a result. It is an ordered list with HowToDirection and/or HowToTip items.

OfferCatalog.name: OfferCatalog
OfferCatalog.description: An OfferCatalog is an ItemList that contains related Offers and/or further OfferCatalogs that are offeredBy the same provider.

CreativeWorkSeries.name: CreativeWorkSeries
CreativeWorkSeries.description:
A CreativeWorkSeries in schema.org is a group of related items, typically but not necessarily of the same kind. CreativeWorkSeries are usually organized into some order, often chronological. Unlike ItemList which is a general purpose data structure for lists of things, the emphasis with CreativeWorkSeries is on published materials (written e.g. books and periodicals, or media such as tv, radio and games).

Specific subtypes are available for describing TVSeries, RadioSeries, MovieSeries, BookSeries, Periodical and VideoGameSeries. In each case, the hasPart / isPartOf properties can be used to relate the CreativeWorkSeries to its parts. The general CreativeWorkSeries type serves largely just to organize these more specific and practical subtypes.

It is common for properties applicable to an item from the series to be usefully applied to the containing group. Schema.org attempts to anticipate some of these cases, but publishers should be free to apply properties of the series parts to the series as a whole wherever they seem appropriate.

ConfirmAction.name: ConfirmAction
ConfirmAction.description:
The act of notifying someone that a future event/action is going to happen as expected.

Related actions:

  • CancelAction: The antonym of ConfirmAction.

DataFeed.name: DataFeed
DataFeed.description: A single feed providing structured information about one or more entities or topics.

State.name: State
State.description: A state or province of a country.

AppendAction.name: AppendAction
AppendAction.description: The act of inserting at the end if an ordered collection.

InteractionCounter.name: InteractionCounter
InteractionCounter.description: A summary of how users have interacted with this CreativeWork. In most cases, authors will use a subtype to specify the specific type of interaction.

ParkingFacility.name: ParkingFacility
ParkingFacility.description: A parking lot or other parking facility.

AuthorizeAction.name: AuthorizeAction
AuthorizeAction.description: The act of granting permission to an object.

BookSeries.name: BookSeries
BookSeries.description: A series of books. Included books can be indicated with the hasPart property.

PawnShop.name: PawnShop
PawnShop.description: A shop that will buy, or lend money against the security of, personal possessions.

AssignAction.name: AssignAction
AssignAction.description: The act of allocating an action/event/task to some destination (someone or something).

PayAction.name: PayAction
PayAction.description: An agent pays a price to a participant.

TypeAndQuantityNode.name: TypeAndQuantityNode
TypeAndQuantityNode.description: A structured value indicating the quantity, unit of measurement, and business function of goods included in a bundle offer.

SteeringPositionValue.name: SteeringPositionValue
SteeringPositionValue.description: A value indicating a steering position.

TrainTrip.name: TrainTrip
TrainTrip.description: A trip on a commercial train line.

Conversation.name: Conversation
Conversation.description: One or more messages between organizations or people on a particular topic. Individual messages can be linked to the conversation with isPartOf or hasPart properties.

ReserveAction.name: ReserveAction
ReserveAction.description:
Reserving a concrete object.

Related actions:

  • ScheduleAction: Unlike ScheduleAction, ReserveAction reserves concrete objects (e.g. a table, a hotel) towards a time slot / spatial allocation.

PaymentService.name: PaymentService
PaymentService.description: A Service to transfer funds from a person or organization to a beneficiary person or organization.

InteractAction.name: InteractAction
InteractAction.description: The act of interacting with another person or organization.

Permit.name: Permit
Permit.description: A permit issued by an organization, e.g. a parking pass.

BodyOfWater.name: BodyOfWater
BodyOfWater.description: A body of water, such as a sea, ocean, or lake.

RadioSeries.name: RadioSeries
RadioSeries.description: CreativeWorkSeries dedicated to radio broadcast and associated online delivery.

HowToItem.name: HowToItem
HowToItem.description: An item used as either a tool or supply when performing the instructions for how to to achieve a result.

ShareAction.name: ShareAction
ShareAction.description: The act of distributing content to people for their amusement or edification.

WPHeader.name: WPHeader
WPHeader.description: The header section of the page.

MarryAction.name: MarryAction
MarryAction.description: The act of marrying a person.

ReactAction.name: ReactAction
ReactAction.description: The act of responding instinctively and emotionally to an object, expressing a sentiment.

Message.name: Message
Message.description: A single message from a sender to one or more organizations or people.

InvestmentOrDeposit.name: InvestmentOrDeposit
InvestmentOrDeposit.description: A type of financial product that typically requires the client to transfer funds to a financial service in return for potential beneficial financial return.

DeactivateAction.name: DeactivateAction
DeactivateAction.description: The act of stopping or deactivating a device or application (e.g. stopping a timer or turning off a flashlight).

DataFeedItem.name: DataFeedItem
DataFeedItem.description: A single item within a larger data feed.

SocialMediaPosting.name: SocialMediaPosting
SocialMediaPosting.description: A post to a social media platform, including blog posts, tweets, Facebook posts, etc.

VoteAction.name: VoteAction
VoteAction.description: The act of expressing a preference from a fixed/finite/structured set of choices/options.

LoanOrCredit.name: LoanOrCredit
LoanOrCredit.description: A financial product for the loaning of an amount of money under agreed terms and charges.

ServiceChannel.name: ServiceChannel
ServiceChannel.description: A means for accessing a service, e.g. a government office location, web site, or phone number.

ExhibitionEvent.name: ExhibitionEvent
ExhibitionEvent.description: Event type: Exhibition event, e.g. at a museum, library, archive, tradeshow, ...

RentAction.name: RentAction
RentAction.description: The act of giving money in return for temporary use, but not ownership, of an object such as a vehicle or property. For example, an agent rents a property from a landlord in exchange for a periodic payment.

EmployeeRole.name: EmployeeRole
EmployeeRole.description: A subclass of OrganizationRole used to describe employee relationships.

PrependAction.name: PrependAction
PrependAction.description: The act of inserting at the beginning if an ordered collection.

CourseInstance.name: CourseInstance
CourseInstance.description: An instance of a Course which is distinct from other instances because it is offered at a different time or location or through different media or modes of study or to a specific section of students.

Hotel.name: Hotel
Hotel.description:
A hotel is an establishment that provides lodging paid on a short-term basis (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hotel).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

IndividualProduct.name: IndividualProduct
IndividualProduct.description: A single, identifiable product instance (e.g. a laptop with a particular serial number).

RadioClip.name: RadioClip
RadioClip.description: A short radio program or a segment/part of a radio program.

Intangible.name: Intangible
Intangible.description: A utility class that serves as the umbrella for a number of 'intangible' things such as quantities, structured values, etc.

Order.name: Order
Order.description: An order is a confirmation of a transaction (a receipt), which can contain multiple line items, each represented by an Offer that has been accepted by the customer.

TVClip.name: TVClip
TVClip.description: A short TV program or a segment/part of a TV program.

ContactPoint.name: ContactPoint
ContactPoint.description: A contact point—for example, a Customer Complaints department.

TelevisionChannel.name: TelevisionChannel
TelevisionChannel.description: A unique instance of a television BroadcastService on a CableOrSatelliteService lineup.

EmergencyService.name: EmergencyService
EmergencyService.description: An emergency service, such as a fire station or ER.

Menu.name: Menu
Menu.description: A structured representation of food or drink items available from a FoodEstablishment.

Periodical.name: Periodical
Periodical.description:
A publication in any medium issued in successive parts bearing numerical or chronological designations and intended, such as a magazine, scholarly journal, or newspaper to continue indefinitely.

See also blog post.

MovieSeries.name: MovieSeries
MovieSeries.description: A series of movies. Included movies can be indicated with the hasPart property.

Series.name: Series
Series.description: A Series in schema.org is a group of related items, typically but not necessarily of the same kind. See also CreativeWorkSeries, EventSeries.

PhotographAction.name: PhotographAction
PhotographAction.description: The act of capturing still images of objects using a camera.

LegislativeBuilding.name: LegislativeBuilding
LegislativeBuilding.description: A legislative building—for example, the state capitol.

PerformingArtsTheater.name: PerformingArtsTheater
PerformingArtsTheater.description: A theater or other performing art center.

BroadcastService.name: BroadcastService
BroadcastService.description: A delivery service through which content is provided via broadcast over the air or online.

WearAction.name: WearAction
WearAction.description: The act of dressing oneself in clothing.

PerformingGroup.name: PerformingGroup
PerformingGroup.description: A performance group, such as a band, an orchestra, or a circus.

Hostel.name: Hostel
Hostel.description:
A hostel - cheap accommodation, often in shared dormitories.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

WinAction.name: WinAction
WinAction.description: The act of achieving victory in a competitive activity.

Quantity.name: Quantity
Quantity.description: Quantities such as distance, time, mass, weight, etc. Particular instances of say Mass are entities like '3 Kg' or '4 milligrams'.

VideoGallery.name: VideoGallery
VideoGallery.description: Web page type: Video gallery page.

DonateAction.name: DonateAction
DonateAction.description: The act of providing goods, services, or money without compensation, often for philanthropic reasons.

Brand.name: Brand
Brand.description: A brand is a name used by an organization or business person for labeling a product, product group, or similar.

Question.name: Question
Question.description: A specific question - e.g. from a user seeking answers online, or collected in a Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) document.

BorrowAction.name: BorrowAction
BorrowAction.description:
The act of obtaining an object under an agreement to return it at a later date. Reciprocal of LendAction.

Related actions:

  • LendAction: Reciprocal of BorrowAction.

ReviewAction.name: ReviewAction
ReviewAction.description: The act of producing a balanced opinion about the object for an audience. An agent reviews an object with participants resulting in a review.

PaintAction.name: PaintAction
PaintAction.description: The act of producing a painting, typically with paint and canvas as instruments.

SportsActivityLocation.name: SportsActivityLocation
SportsActivityLocation.description: A sports location, such as a playing field.

WarrantyPromise.name: WarrantyPromise
WarrantyPromise.description: A structured value representing the duration and scope of services that will be provided to a customer free of charge in case of a defect or malfunction of a product.

Event.name: Event
Event.description: An event happening at a certain time and location, such as a concert, lecture, or festival. Ticketing information may be added via the offers property. Repeated events may be structured as separate Event objects.

House.name: House
House.description: A house is a building or structure that has the ability to be occupied for habitation by humans or other creatures (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House).

DriveWheelConfigurationValue.name: DriveWheelConfigurationValue
DriveWheelConfigurationValue.description: A value indicating which roadwheels will receive torque.

Role.name: Role
Role.description:
Represents additional information about a relationship or property. For example a Role can be used to say that a 'member' role linking some SportsTeam to a player occurred during a particular time period. Or that a Person's 'actor' role in a Movie was for some particular characterName. Such properties can be attached to a Role entity, which is then associated with the main entities using ordinary properties like 'member' or 'actor'.

See also blog post.

ScreeningEvent.name: ScreeningEvent
ScreeningEvent.description: A screening of a movie or other video.

ArriveAction.name: ArriveAction
ArriveAction.description: The act of arriving at a place. An agent arrives at a destination from a fromLocation, optionally with participants.

CreateAction.name: CreateAction
CreateAction.description: The act of deliberately creating/producing/generating/building a result out of the agent.

ScheduleAction.name: ScheduleAction
ScheduleAction.description:
Scheduling future actions, events, or tasks.

Related actions:

  • ReserveAction: Unlike ReserveAction, ScheduleAction allocates future actions (e.g. an event, a task, etc) towards a time slot / spatial allocation.

DiscoverAction.name: DiscoverAction
DiscoverAction.description: The act of discovering/finding an object.

InstallAction.name: InstallAction
InstallAction.description: The act of installing an application.

MonetaryAmount.name: MonetaryAmount
MonetaryAmount.description: A monetary value or range. This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between £1,000 and £1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc. It is recommended to use PriceSpecification Types to describe the price of an Offer, Invoice, etc.

EngineSpecification.name: EngineSpecification
EngineSpecification.description: Information about the engine of the vehicle. A vehicle can have multiple engines represented by multiple engine specification entities.

ActivateAction.name: ActivateAction
ActivateAction.description: The act of starting or activating a device or application (e.g. starting a timer or turning on a flashlight).

RadioEpisode.name: RadioEpisode
RadioEpisode.description: A radio episode which can be part of a series or season.

ReplaceAction.name: ReplaceAction
ReplaceAction.description: The act of editing a recipient by replacing an old object with a new object.

CreditCard.name: CreditCard
CreditCard.description:
A card payment method of a particular brand or name. Used to mark up a particular payment method and/or the financial product/service that supplies the card account.

Commonly used values:

  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#AmericanExpress
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DinersClub
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Discover
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#JCB
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#MasterCard
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#VISA

OpeningHoursSpecification.name: OpeningHoursSpecification
OpeningHoursSpecification.description:
A structured value providing information about the opening hours of a place or a certain service inside a place.

The place is open if the opens property is specified, and closed otherwise.

If the value for the closes property is less than the value for the opens property then the hour range is assumed to span over the next day.

DislikeAction.name: DislikeAction
DislikeAction.description: The act of expressing a negative sentiment about the object. An agent dislikes an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

PlayAction.name: PlayAction
PlayAction.description:
The act of playing/exercising/training/performing for enjoyment, leisure, recreation, Competition or exercise.

Related actions:

  • ListenAction: Unlike ListenAction (which is under ConsumeAction), PlayAction refers to performing for an audience or at an event, rather than consuming music.
  • WatchAction: Unlike WatchAction (which is under ConsumeAction), PlayAction refers to showing/displaying for an audience or at an event, rather than consuming visual content.

TieAction.name: TieAction
TieAction.description: The act of reaching a draw in a competitive activity.

ItemList.name: ItemList
ItemList.description: A list of items of any sort—for example, Top 10 Movies About Weathermen, or Top 100 Party Songs. Not to be confused with HTML lists, which are often used only for formatting.

InformAction.name: InformAction
InformAction.description: The act of notifying someone of information pertinent to them, with no expectation of a response.

ReturnAction.name: ReturnAction
ReturnAction.description: The act of returning to the origin that which was previously received (concrete objects) or taken (ownership).

MeetingRoom.name: MeetingRoom
MeetingRoom.description:
A meeting room, conference room, or conference hall is a room provided for singular events such as business conferences and meetings (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conference_hall).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

OrderAction.name: OrderAction
OrderAction.description: An agent orders an object/product/service to be delivered/sent.

JoinAction.name: JoinAction
JoinAction.description:
An agent joins an event/group with participants/friends at a location.

Related actions:

  • RegisterAction: Unlike RegisterAction, JoinAction refers to joining a group/team of people.
  • SubscribeAction: Unlike SubscribeAction, JoinAction does not imply that you'll be receiving updates.
  • FollowAction: Unlike FollowAction, JoinAction does not imply that you'll be polling for updates.

BuyAction.name: BuyAction
BuyAction.description: The act of giving money to a seller in exchange for goods or services rendered. An agent buys an object, product, or service from a seller for a price. Reciprocal of SellAction.

SearchAction.name: SearchAction
SearchAction.description:
The act of searching for an object.

Related actions:

  • FindAction: SearchAction generally leads to a FindAction, but not necessarily.

HVACBusiness.name: HVACBusiness
HVACBusiness.description: A business that provide Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning services.

ProductModel.name: ProductModel
ProductModel.description: A datasheet or vendor specification of a product (in the sense of a prototypical description).

MovieClip.name: MovieClip
MovieClip.description: A short segment/part of a movie.

WriteAction.name: WriteAction
WriteAction.description: The act of authoring written creative content.

Landform.name: Landform
Landform.description: A landform or physical feature.  Landform elements include mountains, plains, lakes, rivers, seascape and oceanic waterbody interface features such as bays, peninsulas, seas and so forth, including sub-aqueous terrain features such as submersed mountain ranges, volcanoes, and the great ocean basins.

Episode.name: Episode
Episode.description: A media episode (e.g. TV, radio, video game) which can be part of a series or season.

MedicalOrganization.name: MedicalOrganization
MedicalOrganization.description: A medical organization (physical or not), such as hospital, institution or clinic.

TrainReservation.name: TrainReservation
TrainReservation.description:
A reservation for train travel.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use Offer.

Review.name: Review
Review.description: A review of an item - for example, of a restaurant, movie, or store.

ClaimReview.name: ClaimReview
ClaimReview.description: A fact-checking review of claims made (or reported) in some creative work (referenced via itemReviewed).

CollegeOrUniversity.name: CollegeOrUniversity
CollegeOrUniversity.description: A college, university, or other third-level educational institution.

SoftwareSourceCode.name: SoftwareSourceCode
SoftwareSourceCode.description: Computer programming source code. Example: Full (compile ready) solutions, code snippet samples, scripts, templates.

Clip.name: Clip
Clip.description: A short TV or radio program or a segment/part of a program.

Seat.name: Seat
Seat.description: Used to describe a seat, such as a reserved seat in an event reservation.

WantAction.name: WantAction
WantAction.description: The act of expressing a desire about the object. An agent wants an object.

ReadAction.name: ReadAction
ReadAction.description: The act of consuming written content.

TaxiService.name: TaxiService
TaxiService.description: A service for a vehicle for hire with a driver for local travel. Fares are usually calculated based on distance traveled.

Ticket.name: Ticket
Ticket.description: Used to describe a ticket to an event, a flight, a bus ride, etc.

RejectAction.name: RejectAction
RejectAction.description:
The act of rejecting to/adopting an object.

Related actions:

  • AcceptAction: The antonym of RejectAction.

GeoCircle.name: GeoCircle
GeoCircle.description:
A GeoCircle is a GeoShape representing a circular geographic area. As it is a GeoShape
          it provides the simple textual property 'circle', but also allows the combination of postalCode alongside geoRadius.
          The center of the circle can be indicated via the 'geoMidpoint' property, or more approximately using 'address', 'postalCode'.

Energy.name: Energy
Energy.description: Properties that take Energy as values are of the form '<Number> <Energy unit of measure>'.

GovernmentPermit.name: GovernmentPermit
GovernmentPermit.description: A permit issued by a government agency.

InsertAction.name: InsertAction
InsertAction.description: The act of adding at a specific location in an ordered collection.

Resort.name: Resort
Resort.description:
A resort is a place used for relaxation or recreation, attracting visitors for holidays or vacations. Resorts are places, towns or sometimes commercial establishment operated by a single company (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resort).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

Invoice.name: Invoice
Invoice.description: A statement of the money due for goods or services; a bill.

Table.name: Table
Table.description: A table on a Web page.

CompoundPriceSpecification.name: CompoundPriceSpecification
CompoundPriceSpecification.description: A compound price specification is one that bundles multiple prices that all apply in combination for different dimensions of consumption. Use the name property of the attached unit price specification for indicating the dimension of a price component (e.g. "electricity" or "final cleaning").

PeopleAudience.name: PeopleAudience
PeopleAudience.description: A set of characteristics belonging to people, e.g. who compose an item's target audience.

FoodEstablishmentReservation.name: FoodEstablishmentReservation
FoodEstablishmentReservation.description:
A reservation to dine at a food-related business.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations.

PaymentChargeSpecification.name: PaymentChargeSpecification
PaymentChargeSpecification.description: The costs of settling the payment using a particular payment method.

BusReservation.name: BusReservation
BusReservation.description:
A reservation for bus travel.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use Offer.

OrderItem.name: OrderItem
OrderItem.description: An order item is a line of an order. It includes the quantity and shipping details of a bought offer.

TipAction.name: TipAction
TipAction.description: The act of giving money voluntarily to a beneficiary in recognition of services rendered.

HowToDirection.name: HowToDirection
HowToDirection.description: A direction indicating a single action to do in the instructions for how to achieve a result.

Apartment.name: Apartment
Apartment.description: An apartment (in American English) or flat (in British English) is a self-contained housing unit (a type of residential real estate) that occupies only part of a building (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apartment).

NoteDigitalDocument.name: NoteDigitalDocument
NoteDigitalDocument.description: A file containing a note, primarily for the author.

Service.name: Service
Service.description: A service provided by an organization, e.g. delivery service, print services, etc.

Campground.name: Campground
Campground.description:
A camping site, campsite, or campground is a place used for overnight stay in the outdoors. In British English a campsite is an area, usually divided into a number of pitches, where people can camp overnight using tents or camper vans or caravans; this British English use of the word is synonymous with the American English expression campground. In American English the term campsite generally means an area where an individual, family, group, or military unit can pitch a tent or parks a camper; a campground may contain many campsites (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Campsite).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

Thing.name: Thing
Thing.description: The most generic type of item.

AskAction.name: AskAction
AskAction.description:
The act of posing a question / favor to someone.

Related actions:

  • ReplyAction: Appears generally as a response to AskAction.

CommunicateAction.name: CommunicateAction
CommunicateAction.description: The act of conveying information to another person via a communication medium (instrument) such as speech, email, or telephone conversation.

CurrencyConversionService.name: CurrencyConversionService
CurrencyConversionService.description: A service to convert funds from one currency to another currency.

GovernmentService.name: GovernmentService
GovernmentService.description: A service provided by a government organization, e.g. food stamps, veterans benefits, etc.

DeliveryEvent.name: DeliveryEvent
DeliveryEvent.description: An event involving the delivery of an item.

HobbyShop.name: HobbyShop
HobbyShop.description: A store that sells materials useful or necessary for various hobbies.

FollowAction.name: FollowAction
FollowAction.description:
The act of forming a personal connection with someone/something (object) unidirectionally/asymmetrically to get updates polled from.

Related actions:

  • BefriendAction: Unlike BefriendAction, FollowAction implies that the connection is not necessarily reciprocal.
  • SubscribeAction: Unlike SubscribeAction, FollowAction implies that the follower acts as an active agent constantly/actively polling for updates.
  • RegisterAction: Unlike RegisterAction, FollowAction implies that the agent is interested in continuing receiving updates from the object.
  • JoinAction: Unlike JoinAction, FollowAction implies that the agent is interested in getting updates from the object.
  • TrackAction: Unlike TrackAction, FollowAction refers to the polling of updates of all aspects of animate objects rather than the location of inanimate objects (e.g. you track a package, but you don't follow it).

RVPark.name: RVPark
RVPark.description: A place offering space for "Recreational Vehicles", Caravans, mobile homes and the like.

Enumeration.name: Enumeration
Enumeration.description: Lists or enumerations—for example, a list of cuisines or music genres, etc.

BroadcastEvent.name: BroadcastEvent
BroadcastEvent.description: An over the air or online broadcast event.

RentalCarReservation.name: RentalCarReservation
RentalCarReservation.description:
A reservation for a rental car.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations.

OrganizationRole.name: OrganizationRole
OrganizationRole.description: A subclass of Role used to describe roles within organizations.

Canal.name: Canal
Canal.description: A canal, like the Panama Canal.

TVSeries.name: TVSeries
TVSeries.description: CreativeWorkSeries dedicated to TV broadcast and associated online delivery.

AdministrativeArea.name: AdministrativeArea
AdministrativeArea.description: A geographical region, typically under the jurisdiction of a particular government.

DataType.name: DataType
DataType.description: The basic data types such as Integers, Strings, etc.

SuspendAction.name: SuspendAction
SuspendAction.description: The act of momentarily pausing a device or application (e.g. pause music playback or pause a timer).

Distance.name: Distance
Distance.description: Properties that take Distances as values are of the form '<Number> <Length unit of measure>'. E.g., '7 ft'.

MusicPlaylist.name: MusicPlaylist
MusicPlaylist.description: A collection of music tracks in playlist form.

QuantitativeValue.name: QuantitativeValue
QuantitativeValue.description: A point value or interval for product characteristics and other purposes.

BedDetails.name: BedDetails
BedDetails.description: An entity holding detailed information about the available bed types, e.g. the quantity of twin beds for a hotel room. For the single case of just one bed of a certain type, you can use bed directly with a text. See also BedType (under development).

OwnershipInfo.name: OwnershipInfo
OwnershipInfo.description: A structured value providing information about when a certain organization or person owned a certain product.

AcceptAction.name: AcceptAction
AcceptAction.description:
The act of committing to/adopting an object.

Related actions:

  • RejectAction: The antonym of AcceptAction.

ItemPage.name: ItemPage
ItemPage.description: A page devoted to a single item, such as a particular product or hotel.

Language.name: Language
Language.description: Natural languages such as Spanish, Tamil, Hindi, English, etc. Formal language code tags expressed in BCP 47 can be used via the alternateName property. The Language type previously also covered programming languages such as Scheme and Lisp, which are now best represented using ComputerLanguage.

NewsArticle.name: NewsArticle
NewsArticle.description:
A NewsArticle is an article whose content reports news, or provides background context and supporting materials for understanding the news.

A more detailed overview of schema.org News markup is also available.

TheaterGroup.name: TheaterGroup
TheaterGroup.description: A theater group or company, for example, the Royal Shakespeare Company or Druid Theatre.

ParcelDelivery.name: ParcelDelivery
ParcelDelivery.description: The delivery of a parcel either via the postal service or a commercial service.

Answer.name: Answer
Answer.description: An answer offered to a question; perhaps correct, perhaps opinionated or wrong.

AllocateAction.name: AllocateAction
AllocateAction.description: The act of organizing tasks/objects/events by associating resources to it.

ParentAudience.name: ParentAudience
ParentAudience.description: A set of characteristics describing parents, who can be interested in viewing some content.

RadioChannel.name: RadioChannel
RadioChannel.description: A unique instance of a radio BroadcastService on a CableOrSatelliteService lineup.

JobPosting.name: JobPosting
JobPosting.description: A listing that describes a job opening in a certain organization.

MediaObject.name: MediaObject
MediaObject.description: A media object, such as an image, video, or audio object embedded in a web page or a downloadable dataset i.e. DataDownload. Note that a creative work may have many media objects associated with it on the same web page. For example, a page about a single song (MusicRecording) may have a music video (VideoObject), and a high and low bandwidth audio stream (2 AudioObject's).

AccountingService.name: AccountingService
AccountingService.description:
Accountancy business.

As a LocalBusiness it can be described as a provider of one or more Service(s).

CheckInAction.name: CheckInAction
CheckInAction.description:
The act of an agent communicating (service provider, social media, etc) their arrival by registering/confirming for a previously reserved service (e.g. flight check in) or at a place (e.g. hotel), possibly resulting in a result (boarding pass, etc).

Related actions:

  • CheckOutAction: The antonym of CheckInAction.
  • ArriveAction: Unlike ArriveAction, CheckInAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the start of a previously reserved service.
  • ConfirmAction: Unlike ConfirmAction, CheckInAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the start of a previously reserved service rather than its validity/existence.

BusinessAudience.name: BusinessAudience
BusinessAudience.description: A set of characteristics belonging to businesses, e.g. who compose an item's target audience.

LodgingBusiness.name: LodgingBusiness
LodgingBusiness.description: A lodging business, such as a motel, hotel, or inn.

CreativeWorkSeason.name: CreativeWorkSeason
CreativeWorkSeason.description: A media season e.g. tv, radio, video game etc.

Reservation.name: Reservation
Reservation.description:
Describes a reservation for travel, dining or an event. Some reservations require tickets.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, restaurant reservations, flights, or rental cars, use Offer.

FindAction.name: FindAction
FindAction.description:
The act of finding an object.

Related actions:

  • SearchAction: FindAction is generally lead by a SearchAction, but not necessarily.

LockerDelivery.name: LockerDelivery
LockerDelivery.description: A DeliveryMethod in which an item is made available via locker.

RadioSeason.name: RadioSeason
RadioSeason.description: Season dedicated to radio broadcast and associated online delivery.

UpdateAction.name: UpdateAction
UpdateAction.description: The act of managing by changing/editing the state of the object.

AggregateRating.name: AggregateRating
AggregateRating.description: The average rating based on multiple ratings or reviews.

ImageGallery.name: ImageGallery
ImageGallery.description: Web page type: Image gallery page.

Offer.name: Offer
Offer.description:
An offer to transfer some rights to an item or to provide a service — for example, an offer to sell tickets to an event, to rent the DVD of a movie, to stream a TV show over the internet, to repair a motorcycle, or to loan a book.

For GTIN-related fields, see Check Digit calculator and validation guide from GS1.

Product.name: Product
Product.description: Any offered product or service. For example: a pair of shoes; a concert ticket; the rental of a car; a haircut; or an episode of a TV show streamed online.

CampingPitch.name: CampingPitch
CampingPitch.description:
A camping pitch is an individual place for overnight stay in the outdoors, typically being part of a larger camping site.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

GeoCoordinates.name: GeoCoordinates
GeoCoordinates.description: The geographic coordinates of a place or event.

MiddleSchool.name: MiddleSchool
MiddleSchool.description: A middle school (typically for children aged around 11-14, although this varies somewhat).

EatAction.name: EatAction
EatAction.description: The act of swallowing solid objects.

TakeAction.name: TakeAction
TakeAction.description:
The act of gaining ownership of an object from an origin. Reciprocal of GiveAction.

Related actions:

  • GiveAction: The reciprocal of TakeAction.
  • ReceiveAction: Unlike ReceiveAction, TakeAction implies that ownership has been transfered.
